required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of a Common Cold Treatment on Cognitive Function
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Common Cold Treatment on Cognitive Function

brief_summary.textblock: A reduction in alertness and lower levels of performance are commonly associated with the common cold. Paracetamol has been shown to be more effective than placebo in treating symptoms associated with upper respiratory tract infection; caffeine has been shown to increase levels of alertness and improve performance of people suffering from colds. This study will investigate any improvement in alertness and performance based on cognitive function and mood assessment in subjects suffering from the common cold, when taking a novel paracetamol and caffeine combination verses paracetamol alone.

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Valid Responses to Rapid Visual Information Processing (RVIP) Cognitive Test
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 30 minutes post treatment administration
primary_outcome.description: The RVIP assessed the performance of visual attention mechanisms in remaining vigilant to periodically occurring events. Participants monitored a series of single numbers (0-9) appearing in the centre of the screen. During the RVIP task, participants responded to consecutive sequences of three odd or three even numbers by pressing the corresponding response button as quickly and accurately as possible. The test lasted approximately 9 minutes and mean number of valid responses to stimulus was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Valid Responses to RVIP Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: The RVIP assessed the performance of visual attention mechanisms in remaining vigilant to periodically occurring events. Participants monitored a series of single numbers (0-9) appearing in the centre of the screen. During the RVIP task, participants responded to consecutive sequences of three odd or three even numbers by pressing the corresponding response button as quickly and accurately as possible. The test lasted approximately 9 minutes and mean number of valid responses to stimulus was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change in Baseline in Valid Reaction Time to RVIP Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: The RVIP assessed the performance of visual attention mechanisms in remaining vigilant to periodically occurring events. Participants monitored a series of single numbers (0-9) appearing in the centre of the screen. During the RVIP task, participants responded to consecutive sequences of three odd or three even numbers by pressing the corresponding response button as quickly and accurately as possible. Mean valid reaction time was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Incorrect and Missed Responses to RVIP Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: The RVIP assessed the performance of visual attention mechanisms in remaining vigilant to periodically occurring events. Participants monitored a series of single numbers (0-9) appearing in the centre of the screen. During the RVIP task, participants responded to consecutive sequences of three odd or three even numbers by pressing the corresponding response button as quickly and accurately as possible. The test lasted approximately 9 minutes and mean number of valid responses to stimulus was calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Valid Responses to Sustained Attention Tasks (SAT) Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: Auditory and visual attention of participants was evaluated using a validated Sustained Attention task. For the sustained visual attention task, participants were required to respond to the letter 's' every time it appears in a continuous stream of letters presented on a screen. For the sustained auditory attention task, participants responded to the number '8' every time it appears in a continuous stream of numbers presented through headphones. Total test duration was approximately 6 minutes. Mean values of valid responses to visual and auditory tests were calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Incorrect and Missed Responses to SAT Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: Auditory and visual attention of participants was evaluated using a validated Sustained Attention task. For the sustained visual attention task, participants were required to respond to the letter 's' every time it appears in a continuous stream of letters presented on a screen. For the sustained auditory attention task, participants responded to the number '8' every time it appears in a continuous stream of numbers presented through headphones. Total test duration was approximately 6 minutes. Mean values of incorrect and missed responses to visual and auditory tests were calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Valid Reaction Time to SAT Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: Auditory and visual attention of participants was evaluated using a validated Sustained Attention task. For the sustained visual attention task, participants were required to respond to the letter 's' every time it appears in a continuous stream of letters presented on a screen. For the sustained auditory attention task, participants responded to the number '8' every time it appears in a continuous stream of numbers presented through headphones. Total test duration was approximately 6 minutes. Mean values of valid reaction time to visual and auditory tests were calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Valid Responses to Divided Attention Task (DAT) Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: For the DAT Cognitive test, auditory and visual stimuli were simultaneously presented and participants were asked to respond to occurrences of 's' (visual) or '8' (auditory). Total test duration was approximately 6 minutes. Mean values of valid responses to visual and auditory tests were calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Valid Reaction Time to DAT Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: For the DAT Cognitive test, auditory and visual stimuli were simultaneously presented and participants were asked to respond to occurrences of 's' (visual) or '8' (auditory). Total test duration was approximately 6 minutes. Mean values of valid reaction time to visual and auditory tests were calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Incorrect and Missed Responses to DAT Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: For the DAT Cognitive test, auditory and visual stimuli were simultaneously presented and participants were asked to respond to occurrences of 's' (visual) or '8' (auditory). Total test duration was approximately 6 minutes. Mean values of incorrect and missed responses to visual and auditory tests were calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Mood Alertness and Physical Sensation Scales (MAPSS) Cognitive Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
secondary_outcome.description: Mood patterns was evaluated using the Mood, Alertness and Physical Sensation Scales (MAPSS) which comprised of 23 questions describing moods and physical sensations, on a 9-point scale anchored at the left hand end with 'not at all' and the right hand end with 'extremely'. For each question, '9' represented the 'best' score and '1' represented the 'worst' score. Mean score was calculated by summing the responses and dividing by the number of questions answered. MAPSS Questionnaire was further divided into three main clusters: Alertness; Anxiety and Headache as per the questions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Present with symptoms of the common cold of no more than 96 hours duration
- Score of "2" or more on a self-rating for malaise and at least 4 other cold symptoms
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy or lactation
- Hypersensitivity to drugs
- Have taken caffeine in the last 12 hours or treated their cold

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at the clinical site.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 75 participants were screened, and 72 were randomized. 3 participants did not meet the study criterion. A 5 hour washout period was maintained between treatment periods.

group.title: Paracetamol/ Caffeine Tablet Then Paracetamol Powder
group.description: Participants were orally administered with 200 millilitre (mL) solution of two soluble tablets, [each tablet containing 500 milligram (mg) paracetamol and 65 mg of caffeine], then 200 mL solution of paracetamol soluble powder (1000 mg). A washout period of 5 hours was maintained.

group.title: Paracetamol Powder Then Paracetamol/ Caffeine Tablet
group.description: Participants were orally administered with 200 mL solution of paracetamol soluble powder (1000 mg), then 200 mL solution of two soluble tablets [each tablet containing 500 mg paracetamol and 65 mg of caffeine]. A washout period of 5 hours was maintained.

participants_list.participants: 1 participant withdrew prior receiving the treatment

group.title: All Randomized Participants
group.description: All randomized participants were evaluated for baseline measures.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Valid Responses to Rapid Visual Information Processing (RVIP) Cognitive Test
outcome.description: The RVIP assessed the performance of visual attention mechanisms in remaining vigilant to periodically occurring events. Participants monitored a series of single numbers (0-9) appearing in the centre of the screen. During the RVIP task, participants responded to consecutive sequences of three odd or three even numbers by pressing the corresponding response button as quickly and accurately as possible. The test lasted approximately 9 minutes and mean number of valid responses to stimulus was calculated.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 30 minutes post treatment administration
outcome.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants who were randomized and had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation.

group.title: Paracetamol/ Caffeine Tablet
group.description: Participants were orally administered with 200 mL solution of two soluble tablets, each tablet containing 500 mg paracetamol and 65 mg of caffeine.

group.title: Paracetamol Powder
group.description: Participants were orally administered with 200 mL solution of 1000 mg paracetamol soluble powder.

measure.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Valid Responses to Rapid Visual Information Processing (RVIP) Cognitive Test
measure.description: The RVIP assessed the performance of visual attention mechanisms in remaining vigilant to periodically occurring events. Participants monitored a series of single numbers (0-9) appearing in the centre of the screen. During the RVIP task, participants responded to consecutive sequences of three odd or three even numbers by pressing the corresponding response button as quickly and accurately as possible. The test lasted approximately 9 minutes and mean number of valid responses to stimulus was calculated.
measure.population: Intent-To-Treat (ITT) population: All randomized participants who were randomized and had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis was no difference in treatments in the change from baseline in the number of valid responses from the RVIP.
analysis.method_desc: No baseline covariate adjustment was carried out.
analysis.estimate_desc: A positive difference favors the paracetamol/ caffeine treatment.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Number of Valid Responses to RVIP Cognitive Test
outcome.description: The RVIP assessed the performance of visual attention mechanisms in remaining vigilant to periodically occurring events. Participants monitored a series of single numbers (0-9) appearing in the centre of the screen. During the RVIP task, participants responded to consecutive sequences of three odd or three even numbers by pressing the corresponding response button as quickly and accurately as possible. The test lasted approximately 9 minutes and mean number of valid responses to stimulus was calculated.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 60 minutes post treatment administration
outcome.population: ITT population: All randomized participants who were randomized and had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation.

outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline in Mood Alertness and Physical Sensation Scales (MAPSS) Cognitive Test
outcome.description: Mood patterns was evaluated using the Mood, Alertness and Physical Sensation Scales (MAPSS) which comprised of 23 questions describing moods and physical sensations, on a 9-point scale anchored at the left hand end with ‘not at all’ and the right hand end with ‘extremely’. For each question, ‘9’ represented the ‘best’ score and ‘1’ represented the ‘worst’ score. Mean score was calculated by summing the responses and dividing by the number of questions answered. MAPSS Questionnaire was further divided into three main clusters: Alertness; Anxiety and Headache as per the questions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 30 minutes and up to 60 minutes post treatment administration
outcome.population: ITT population: All randomized participants who were randomized and had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation.

For each question, ‘9’ represented the ‘best’ score and ‘1’ represented the ‘worst’ score. Mean score was calculated by summing the responses and dividing by the number of questions answered. MAPSS Questionnaire was further divided into three main clusters: Alertness; Anxiety and Headache as per the questions.
measure.population: ITT population: All randomized participants who were randomized and had at least one post-baseline efficacy evaluation.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events were collected from the start of the investigational product and until 5 days following last administration of the investigational product.

group.title: Paracetamol/Caffeine Tablet
group.description: Participants were orally administered with 200 mL solution of two soluble tablets, each tablet containing 500 mg paracetamol and 65 mg of caffeine.

group.title: Paracetamol Powder
group.description: Participants were orally administered with 200 mL solution of 1000 mg paracetamol soluble powder.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Apparent carryover effect from the paracetamol/ caffeine treatment taken in Period 1 into the baseline assessment of Period 2 was observed, hence the statistical analysis was amended after unblinding the statistician.
